intro: Psychotria heterosticta var. acuminata, commonly known as the acuminata variant of the evergreen shrub Psychotria, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically glossy and dark green in color. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are often accompanied by a strong, sometimes unpleasant odor. Its fruit is a small, capsule-like structure that contains several seeds. This species is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other plants known for their ornamental and medicinal properties.
